Accessed on 2008-07-02. | population_total = 771890 | population_as_of = 2008 | population_density_km2 = auto | population_demonym = | timezone1 = CET | utc_offset1 = +01 | iso_code = DZ-44 | area_code_type = Area Code | area_code = +213 (0) 27 | blank_name_sec1 = Districts | blank_info_sec1 = 14 | blank1_name_sec1 = Municipalities | blank1_info_sec1 = 36 | website = | footnotes = }} Aïn Defla is a province in northern Algeria. It is southwest of Algiers, the capital. Towns in Ain Delfa include Miliana, Hammam Righa, and Aïn Torki. ==Administrative divisions== The province has 14 districts and 36 municipalities. The districts are: # Aïn Defla # Aïn Lechiakh # Bathia # Bordj El Amir Khaled # Boumedfaâ # Djendel # Djelida # El Abadia # El Amra # El Attaf # Hammam Righa # Khemis # Miliana # Rouina ==References== Category:Provinces of Algeria
title: Aïn Defla Province
